results.title: CES 2024 Highlights Day 2: Fascinating Gadgets - Dataconomy
results.content: Singapore-based startup Tack One unveiled the latest version of its Tack GPS Plus at CES 2024. This AI-powered location technology device is designed to keep track of children, elderly family members, and pets. The new generation features extended battery life and affordable subscription plans starting at $2.95 monthly for a two-year plan.
results.raw_content:
CES 2024 highlights from Day 2: Fascinating gadgets
Now, it's time to shift our focus to some of the most fascinating products unveiled at CES 2024
Take a look at the CES 2024 highlights of day 2. The second day is filled with a wide array of fascinating products and pioneering breakthroughs. This year’s event is a showcase for some of the most substantial technological advancements, ranging from innovative wearables to cutting-edge autonomous vehicles.
Biggest CES 2024 highlights
Now, it’s time to shift our focus to some of the most fascinating products unveiled at CES 2024.
CES 2024 announcements: Most interesting products
Amazon CES 2024
At CES 2024, Amazon has announced it will be the pioneering company to integrate Matter Casting into its smart displays and smart TVs. This feature of the Matter smart home standard allows for seamless video and audio streaming.
Users of Amazon’s Prime Video app on Android and iOS will soon be able to cast content directly to compatible Amazon devices, beginning with the Echo Show 15, by utilizing a newly added dedicated Matter Casting button. Furthermore, Amazon has revealed that Matter Casting will be extended to Fire TVs and smart TVs from Panasonic featuring Fire TV, alongside app integrations with Plex, Pluto TV, Sling TV, Starz, and ZDF later in the year.
Additionally, Amazon, which announced in September its plans to develop new tools for large language model-powered experiences, showcased these innovations at CES 2024. These include new generative AI-powered Alexa experiences, featuring collaborations with Character.AI, Splash, and Volley. These experiences, which are now accessible in the Amazon Alexa Skill Store, highlight Amazon’s commitment to enhancing interactive AI technology, making them one of the significant CES 2024 highlights.
Google CES 2024
Google, in its CES 2024 showcase, introduced a new feature for electric vehicle (EV) drivers. This feature allows the real-time tracking and display of battery information within Google Maps. Compatible with EVs equipped with Android Auto, this secondary interface operates via the user’s phone, enabling wireless connectivity to project features such as navigation, media, and messaging from their Android smartphone to the vehicle’s display.
This integration between Android Auto and Google Maps ensures that drivers have access to crucial battery information in real-time, further enhancing the EV driving experience. This development is yet another notable highlight of CES 2024.
Google and Samsung are making strides in content sharing technology, as announced at CES 2024. They are merging their respective sharing solutions into a unified cross-Android platform named Quick Share. This integration combines Google’s Nearby Share and Samsung’s Quick Share, expanding the network of devices across the Android ecosystem, including Chromebooks.
The collaboration aims to establish “the best default, built-in-option for peer-to-peer content sharing” within the Android and Chromebook environments. Additionally, Google is collaborating with PC manufacturers such as LG to extend Quick Share to Windows PCs as a pre-installed app. The rollout of Quick Share, starting next month, promises to enhance the connectivity and sharing capabilities across a broad range of devices, marking it as one of the significant CES 2024 highlights.
Honda CES 2024
Honda has introduced its upcoming 0 series electric vehicles at CES 2024, offering a fresh perspective in the EV market with a design that is both thin and light. This approach contrasts with the typically thicker and heavier designs seen in the EV sector.
Honda showcased two concept vehicles, the Saloon and Space-Hub, and announced that the first commercial model in its 0 series EV lineup is set to launch in North America in 2026. This launch is poised to be a pivotal moment in the evolution of electric vehicles, as Honda aims to set a new trend in the EV market.
Today at #CES2024 we debuted the “Honda 0 Series" EV concept models, Saloon and Space-Hub. #Honda0 https://t.co/p7pvpXfnRg pic.twitter.com/Ij7gHCqYtL
— Honda (@Honda) January 9, 2024
Hyundai CES 2024
Hyundai Motor Group’s subsidiary, Supernal, showcased its electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft, the S-A2, at CES 2024. This event provided a preview of the aircraft on the ground in Las Vegas, ahead of its anticipated 2028 launch. The S-A2 is designed for passenger shuttling, embodying Hyundai’s vision for the future of urban air mobility. This showcase represents a leap forward in the development of eVTOL aircraft, adding to the list of innovative CES 2024 highlights.
Mobinn, a new venture spun off from Hyundai, made its presence known at CES with a demonstration of its innovative delivery robot. This robot is equipped with flexible wheels designed to navigate stairs and changes in elevation, thus enhancing its delivery capabilities. The company has already begun testing this technology in Korea, showcasing its potential to revolutionize the delivery process.
Kodiak CES 2024
At CES 2024, Kodiak Robotics, an autonomous trucking startup, showcased a semi-truck that founder Don Burnette describes as “the linchpin in its plans to launch commercial driverless operations this year.” The company has emphasized the inclusion of redundant safety features in the truck. This approach ensures that there are backup systems available in the event of any failures, particularly when the vehicle is on the highway with a driver at the wheel. This development by Kodiak Robotics is a significant step towards safer and more efficient autonomous trucking, making it one of the key CES 2024 highlights in the field of autonomous transportation.
The driverless era is here.
Introducing our state-of-the-art Gen6 truck, the world's first and only driverless-ready semi-truck designed for scaled deployment.#AutonomousTrucks #Technology #Innovation pic.twitter.com/OFdC7E7JcW
— Kodiak (@KodiakRobotics) January 9, 2024
OneCourt CES 2024
OneCourt, a startup founded by recent University of Washington graduates, introduced an innovative lap-top miniature field at CES 2024. This technology is designed to assist individuals who are blind or have low vision by enabling them to feel the positions of sports players and the ball in near real-time. The team at OneCourt achieves this by transmitting data to a haptic display with a touchable cover that mimics the pitch or field lines, offering a unique and inclusive way to experience sports.
Walmart CES 2024
Walmart’s president and CEO, Doug McMillon, unveiled several new technologies at CES 2024, focusing on enhancing the retail experience. The company is exploring advancements in augmented reality (AR), drones, generative AI, and other AI technologies aimed at improving shopping for customers. The presentation included new tools for product search and replenishment, as well as a beta version of an AR social commerce platform named “Shop with Friends.” These innovations underscore Walmart’s commitment to integrating cutting-edge technology in retail, further highlighting the diverse range of CES 2024 highlights.
Health tools and wearables from CES 2024
This year’s event has seen the unveiling of a range of interesting health tools and wearables.
Serenity is showcasing its innovative fall-detection system at CES for the first time. This user-friendly system requires no app or configurations – simply plug it in to start. It leverages advanced radar technology and AI to monitor up to two individuals within a 40-foot radius, even through walls, providing detailed insights into their activities. This technology stands out as a key CES 2024 highlight in the realm of health and safety.
Skyted introduced its silent communication mask, a notable CES 2024 highlight. This mask incorporates advanced noise-absorption technology, ensuring secure and confidential voice calls, even in public spaces. Users can now make calls without worrying about eavesdroppers, a significant advancement for privacy in communication.
Singapore-based startup Tack One unveiled the latest version of its Tack GPS Plus at CES 2024. This AI-powered location technology device is designed to keep track of children, elderly family members, and pets. The new generation features extended battery life and affordable subscription plans starting at $2.95 monthly for a two-year plan. Tack One initially launched its GPS tracker in 2021, addressing the market need for longer battery life and more cost-effective tracking services. Its battery lasts for 30 days on a single charge and includes a patent-pending indoor elevation finder feature.
Vivoo, a company specializing in at-home health tests, launched a new test capable of detecting urinary tract infections (UTIs) at CES 2024. The At-Home UTI Test from Vivoo simplifies the UTI diagnostic process. It uses your phone’s camera to capture and analyze the color readout from test strips, providing results and context through its free app. This innovation in home health testing is another significant highlight among the CES 2024 highlights, offering a convenient and accessible solution for UTI detection.
Featured image credit: CES

results.title: Chinese products shine at CES 2024 - Chinadaily.com.cn
results.content: A blend of cutting-edge technologies, new launches and quirky gadgets are expected to swarm the show floor, showcasing the latest trends and innovation in the consumer electronics industries.
results.raw_content:
Chinese products shine at CES 2024
The 2024 Consumer Electronics Show (CES), the world's premier tech show, kicked off in the US city of Las Vegas on Tuesday.
The annual event, running from Tuesday to Friday, has attracted more than 130,000 attendees and over 4,000 exhibitors from more than 150 countries and regions, including over 1,200 startups, according to the Consumer Technology Association (CTA), the organizer of the CES.
The number of attendees has gone up from about 115,000 last year and 45,000 in 2022, according to CTA.
A blend of cutting-edge technologies, new launches and quirky gadgets are expected to swarm the show floor, showcasing the latest trends and innovation in the consumer electronics industries.
Chinese companies have been important forces at CES in recent years, impressing global exhibitors with innovative products and solutions, with over 1,100 Chinese companies and their overseas branches participating in the tech show.

results.title: Guangdong Mcdodo Industrial Co., Ltd - IFA Berlin 2023
results.content: Its main products include cable, charging products, video & audio products as well as small household electrical appliance. In 2015, Mcdodo issued the first " Auto Disconnect Cable", it is the first brand to introduce the concept of "Auto Disconnect" into USB cable, creating a new period of USB cable safe charging with auto disconnect function.
results.raw_content:
​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​
Exhibitors
Guangdong Mcdodo Industrial Co., Ltd
Guangdong Mcdodo Industrial Co., Ltd. was established in 2012, A 3C digital brand focusing on fast charging technology. Its main products include cable, charging products, video & audio products as well as small household electrical appliance.
In 2015, Mcdodo issued the first " Auto Disconnect Cable", it is the first brand to introduce the concept of "Auto Disconnect" into USB cable, creating a new period of USB cable safe charging with auto disconnect function. Mcdodo auto disconnect cable had great feedback after issuing, and created an amazing record to sell million pieces in a year.
Here comes the 5G time, fast charging technology is fully popularized. Mcdodo quickly focused on the development of fast charging products, and issued the first fast charging charger in 2017, which can fully charge the mobile in short time. In 2020, Mcdodo issued the new technology product- GAN charger, which inserts USA imported chip. Mcdodo GAN charger combines lightweight and high efficiency, solving the multi-device fast charging problem for mobile office workers.
After 8 years innovative and hard working, Mcdodo already becomes a world famous brand. Until now, Mcdodo
products are exported to 100 countries in Europe, America, Southeast Asia and other regions.
Our product concept is “ Quality, Safety, Efficient, Easy to Use, Unique”. We warmly welcome customers from at home and abroad to establish cooperation and create a bright future with us together.

results.title: CES 2024 - An Industrial Designer's Perspective - LinkedIn
results.content: This highlights the significance of a well-rounded industrial design strategy, encompassing brand development, a cohesive design language, a strategic product roadmap, and a distinct product identity.
results.raw_content:

CES 2024 â€“ An Industrial Designer's Perspective
Industrial Craft
CES made a jubilant return, attracting a post-pandemic crowd of tech enthusiasts eager to explore the latest global innovations. With over 150,000 attendees, it boasted the highest turnout in recent years. Yet, as an industrial designer, I couldn't help but have some reservations about its implications and our role as industrial designers. Let's delve into that.
Amid the scent of freshly manufactured injection-molded parts and newly minted PCBs, there lingered a familiar "Foxconn" aroma. When most of the displayed products seem far from essential, we must prioritize environmental sustainability over consumerism. The near absence of sustainable strategies from companies is a serious concern. What steps are we taking as industrial designers to help  lead sustainable strategies for the companies we collaborate with?
One stark observation at CES was its ongoing male-dominated attendance, with roughly 80% of participants being men. (I did my own hack reaserch by counting 20 people walking past me. 18/20 were male) This raises intriguing questions about the products tailored to this demographic and prompts us to envision how CES might evolve with more women-led companies involved. In a memorable conversation with the lead engineer of a speaker company known for its predominantly black masculine-looking designs.  I shared insights from my work on Sonos products. I recounted how ethnographic research revealed that women, who often play a pivotal role in purchasing new speakers, were particularly concerned about how these devices would harmonize with the aesthetics of their homes, especially with white walls. Hence Sonos comes in both black and white.) It was an enlightening moment, emphasizing the relevance of diversity in our industrial design teams and the importance of ethnographic research and inclusive design in product development.
Arguably, the most significant shift from a few years ago was the influx of Chinese OBMâ€™s (Original Brand Manufacturing)  companies design, produce, and sell products under their own brand name) at CES. These companies showcased a diverse array of products, many of which bore striking resemblances to offerings from established global brands like Dyson, iRobot, GoPro, and Apple. Surprisingly, this unapologetic emulation of major brands doesn't appear to raise significant concerns among these OBMs or attendees. What implications does this hold for industrial designers who often find inspiration in creating mood boards from other consumer electronic products. And then what role will AI play for industrial designers who key offering is product styling?
However, what truly stood out to me were the exceptional levels of build quality displayed by these Chinese OBMs. In an era where consumers increasingly turn to online e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Alibaba, new shopping behaviors have emerged. People often prioritize star ratings over well-established brand names when making purchasing decisions. Major global brands are reevaluating their reliance on physical stores to convey their identity, underscoring the role of innovative industrial design in building a strong and consistent design and brand language.
Chinese factories have been manufacturing American-designed products since the early '90s and have perfected the "know-how" required to produce high-quality items. This transformation over the years has been remarkable. Moreover, Chinese design schools are producing **10,000 graduates annually. The influx of "good enough" products from Chinese "knock-off" brands, offering a plethora of aesthetic choices at competitive prices, presents a challenge to established global brands.  Companies like, Sony, Samsung, and LG must focus on maintaining a strong brand identity, a consistent design language, and providing consumers with compelling reasons to choose their products beyond aesthetics or they will be competing on price against the Chinese OBMâ€™s
It was a pleasant experience to witness various companies exploring electrical energy storage solutions powered by solar energy at CES. These innovations ranged from comprehensive whole-house setups featuring Lithium-Ion batteries, solar panels, and inverters to Lithium-Ion emergency backup generators designed to replace fossil fuel generators. These developments underscore the need for environmentally conscious industrial design practices within our field.
In my opinion, the most captivating section of the show was dedicated to startups. These companies presented a myriad of intriguing product ideas, from robots designed to entertain your dog while you're at work to a groundbreaking toothbrush promising the same results as an electric brush in a fraction of the time. However, many of these startups faced a fundamental challengeâ€”they were product-focused rather than having a comprehensive approach to their companies. When I inquired about their plans for a second or third product, most seemed perplexed. This highlights the significance of a well-rounded industrial design strategy, encompassing brand development, a cohesive design language, a strategic product roadmap, and a distinct product identity.
Licensing also appeared to be on the rise, with some notable examples, such as Reebok licensing its brand to an electric scooter company and Kodak licensing its brand for use in smartwatches, headphones, speakers, and other unrelated products, departing from the original Kodak brand. The liberal use of brands in this manner raised concerns, reminiscent of the final flicker of a dying star before it collapses into a black hole. Industrial designers must carefully consider the implications of such licensing agreements on brand identity and design coherence.
A significant shift was evident in the tech landscape as wearable technology, which dominated CES five years ago, gave way to scooters. The show featured a plethora of scooter-related products from various companies, most offering similar functionality but differing in design aesthetics. This shift underscores the dynamic nature of industrial design trends and the importance of staying attuned to evolving consumer interests.
Innovation in consumer electronics is becoming increasingly cost-intensive, often accessible only to larger international brands with the financial resources required to push the envelope. With startup funds dwindling and the rise of Chinese OBMs, opportunities for industrial designers have become scarcer. This changing landscape compels us to consider innovative approaches and adaptability in our design practice.
In conclusion, CES 2024 provided invaluable insights for industrial designers, emphasizing the importance of sustainability, adaptability, innovation, and a holistic approach to product design and the importance of industrial design as part of brand.
**More than 11,000 industrial design students graduate annually from 230 schools in China (National Instructional Committee of Industrial Design Education China, 2005).

results.title: Mcdodo Life | LinkedIn
results.content: Quezon City, National Capital Region Shenzhen Benks Technology Co.,Ltd Shenzhen, Guangdong Wholesale Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Dongguan City, Guangdong Province Mcdodo Life |...
results.raw_content:
Mcdodo Life
Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
Guangzhou, Guangdong
217 followers
About us
About us
Founded in 2013, Mcdodo is a design-driven, multi-creative global leader in consumer electronics. Mcdodo is rich in digital peripheral products, including cable, charger, power bank, car accessories etc., and committed to providing quality and practical electronic products to consumers around the world.
Mcdodo has a complete supply chain and sales network integrating design, R&D, production and sales. After years of development, the products are exported to more than 100 countries and regions around the world, with thousands of sales outlets.
IndependentÂ R&D
Mcdodo has its own independent design and development team, which brings together a group of senior R&D engineers and designers in different fields to form the most rigorous and dynamic team. Breaking the original, bold innovation, blending product creativity with life aesthetics to make each product has its own distinctive attributes.
Perfect and detailed control throughout Mcdodo's product development design process, each quality product, from the inside out, carefully crafted to provide users with a valuable experience, is the team's consistent pursuit of consistent!
Production ability
We have our own production management team and quality management team, follow the standardized process, strictly control each production process, and ensure that the products meet the relevant requirements. Our products have kinds of international certifications, such as CE, CCC, RoHS, FCC, ETL, UL and MSDS.
Design concept
We always adhere to the "practical, safe, cost-effective" product design orientation, accurately capture market development and fashion trends, in-depth study of consumer habits and appeals, constantly innovate and optimize products to enhance user experience and satisfaction of consumers' growing demand for smart digital peripherals.

results.title: AGC to showcase cutting-edge glass solutions at CES 2024
results.content: AGC will be on hand to showcase 20 cutting-edge solutions, mainly glass for the auto industry, all focusing on three areas: detection, connection and comfortability, to lead the next generation of mobility. AGC has been in operation for over a century, supplying innovative materials and solutions to meet the demands of the ever-changing society.
results.raw_content:
Back
Back
Search by Application
Search by Business Category
Search by Name
Search by Keyword
back
Back
Back
December 5, 2023Exhibitions & Events
AGC to showcase cutting-edge glass solutions at CES 2024
AGC, a Tokyo-based world-class glass, chemicals and high-tech materials manufacturer for the mobility industry, announced its second appearance at CES 2024. AGC will be on hand to showcase 20 cutting-edge solutions, mainly glass for the auto industry, all focusing on three areas: detection, connection and comfortability, to lead the next generation of mobility.
AGC has been in operation for over a century, supplying innovative materials and solutions to meet the demands of the ever-changing society. As it works to shift automotive glass from simply serving as a barrier to becoming multi-functional, the company approaches its products through the lens of creating not only economic value but also social value.
“At AGC, we firmly believe that glass and performance chemicals permeate every aspect of your living environment, enabling us to drive innovation across all domains with our cutting-edge technology,” said Hideyuki Kurata, CTO. “We have been refining core technologies such as material technology, functional design, and production technology since its foundation. With our advanced materials and solutions showcased at CES, we aim to drive innovation in the next generation of mobility. We invite you to experience them firsthand at our booth."
The products AGC will highlight at the show include:
Detection: Wideye
● Wideye is an infrared, transparent and high-optical performance automotive glass for vision glazing, trims and sensor covers. It is specially crafted for advanced driver assistance systems and autonomous driving and can be mounted on multiple vehicle parts to ensure optimal protection while maintaining a sleek design.
Connection: 5G-compatible Glass Antenna
● Elegantly designed, these glass antennas are compatible with all frequencies of 5G. They can be installed from the interior side of existing window glass, thereby converting the windows into antennas. Halo.Car, an innovative Las Vegas-based EV driverless car service that uses 5G, has incorporated AGC’s glass antennas, which have been used strategically to minimize communication drops.
Comfortability: Automotive Display Cover Glass
● We were the first in the world to introduce automotive display cover glass. Leveraging advanced processing technology, quality, and strength, as well as the advantages of film deposition technologies such as anti-reflective and fingerprint-resistant coatings, we have achieved "safety", "high visibility", and "superior aesthetics". This time, we are planning to showcase large, curved displays.
CES attendees and automotive enthusiasts can visit the AGC exhibition to learn more about these innovations at Booth 6667 in LVCC West Hall Vehicle Tech & Advanced Mobility. AGC representatives and executives will be at the booth to demonstrate the technologies and answer any question.
About AGC:
AGC Inc. (Headquarters: Tokyo, President & CEO: Yoshinori Hirai) is the parent company of the AGC Group, a world leading glass solution provider and supplier of flat, automotive and display glass, chemicals, ceramics and other high-tech materials and components. Building on more than a century of technical innovation, the AGC Group has developed a wide range of cutting-edge products. The Group employs some 57,000 people worldwide and generates annual sales of around 2.0 trillion Japanese yen (approx. US$ 13.2bn) through its operations in more than 30 countries and regions. Learn more at AGC’s site and on LinkedIn.
About CES:
CES® is the most powerful tech event in the world – the proving ground for breakthrough technologies and global innovators. This is where the world's biggest brands do business and meet new partners, and the sharpest innovators hit the stage. Owned and produced by the Consumer Technology Association (CTA)®, CES features every aspect of the tech sector. CES 2024 will take place Jan. 9-12, 2024 in Las Vegas. Learn more at CES.tech and follow @CES on social.

About CES
CES® is the most powerful tech event in the world — the proving ground for breakthrough technologies and global innovators. This is where brands get business done, meet new partners and where the industry’s sharpest minds take the stage to unveil their latest releases and boldest breakthroughs. Owned and produced by the Consumer Technology Association (CTA)®, CES is the only trade show that showcases the entire tech landscape at one event.
About CES
CES showcases companies including manufacturers, developers and suppliers of consumer technology hardware, content, technology delivery systems and more.
It also includes a conference program where the world's business leaders and pioneering thinkers address the industry's most relevant issues.
Find out more about the global impact of CES 2023.
CES 2023 Attendee Audit Summary
arrow-black
All together. All ON.
Registration is now open for CES® 2024 — taking place Jan. 9-12, in Las Vegas.
Register Now

CES Daily
Keep up with breaking news and product coverage from the CES show floor with the digital version of The Official CES Daily, from the editors of TWICE.
Day 3 Issue
arrow-black
Issues are distributed by brand ambassadors in hotel rooms, shuttle buses, throughout the LVCC and the Venetian. Digital editions arrive in advance of the show and also at CES.

Future Show Dates

Follow CES on Social Media
History of CES. The first Consumer Electronic Show kicked off in 1967, with 250 exhibitors and 17,500 attendees in New York City. Since then, CES has grown by more than 10-fold and now encompasses both traditional and non-traditional tech industries.
